content.description:
A great power endurance traverse, following a continuous line of holds along a weakness in a wide roof. Start at the far right side of the line of huecos under the overhang. Steep pockets and slopers lead to a crux crossing the steepest portion of the roof with sloping huecos and undercut feet, finishing at a right-facing jug. Match this hold and head left to a vertical topout.  

  Check the holds for spiders before attempting.
content.protection: Most of the traverse is low to the ground with the exception of the crux and topout, bring enough pads to cover (or a spotter to move your pad.)
content.location: Right-left traverse of the line of holds under the roof. Walk off.

content.description: The Gomez Traverse is powerful and pumpy, a solid 50+ feet of pockets and slopers following a weakness in a roof. There are a few short problems that head straight out the roof as well, and a wall to the right with some good warmup/moderate climbing.
